titleStmt.title: Good order established in Pennsilvania & New-Jersey in America being a true account of the country; with its produce and commodities there made. And the great improvements that may be made by means of publick store-houses for hemp, flax and linnen-cloth; also, the advantages of a publick school, the profits of a publick-bank, and the probability of its arising, if those directions here laid down are followed. With the advantages of publick granaries. ... By Thomas Budd.
titleStmt.author: Budd, Thomas, 1648-1699.

notesStmt.note: Place of publication and printer's name from Evans and Hildeburn; Wing suggests [London?, Andrew Sowle?].
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
